Key: It's time for lunch.
All right. Let's do lunch.
Tohka-chan, eat with us.
The weather is nice, so let's go to the rooftop.

Ohhh! Lunch with everyone! Then, how about
we all exchange meals?

...Tohka sure has been getting closer with those
three lately.

I want to eat lunch, but I can't find Origami. I don't
see her anywhere.
(Oh, well. Guess I could eat alone.)
Hm? Wait a minute. Tonomachi's over there.
What is it, Itsuka-kun?
It's been a while. Wanna eat lunch together?

Sorry, Itsuka. I don't eat lunch with guys who
have girlfriends.
What the heck...?

I'm about to hit the cafeteria. Good-bye,
Itsuka-kun. Hope your lunch is cold and sad.
Hey, Tonomachi!
...Where does that bastard get off?

Man, guess it's the classroom for me. If I can't
find Origami, I can eat by myself.
Hm. Where did Origami go?
(In the end, I ate by myself in the inner yard.)

(Eating alone is kind of sad. I've been lucky
enough to eat with Origami lately.)
(I seriously hope she's okay...)

*yawn*... Man, I'm exhausted. Nothing worse
than the post-lunch food coma.

(I can't nap in my classroom, so maybe I can
take a walk to get the blood flowing.)

(I was walking aimlessly around school before
poking my head inside of the nurse's office.)

Oh, the nurse. I don't think I've looked in
there.

(I doubt I'll find Origami here, but it wouldn't
hurt to check.)
(Hm...? Wait a minute. Someone's inside...)

Are we really doing this...? What if someone
sees us?
It'll be fine. Hurry.

(That's Origami's voice. Who else is with her?
It sounds like a lady.)
Will something that long... fit?

It looks longer than it looks, but it fits better
than you think. Now give it a shot. Hurry
up, hop on it.
How can I hop on it...? I'm scared.
It's fine. Everyone does it.
(What the... What are they doing?)
The tip is hot.

Be gentle with it. That’s right. Now, move
it slowly.

(What's going on? It's not good to eavesdrop,
but I'm so curious.)
I'll put it in. Ready?
Go ahead. Do it slow.
...It's in.
What do you think? Not too hard, right?

Not at all. It fit in much easier than I thought
it would.
(O-Origami... What went in?!)
But are you sure about this?

This is nothing. I'm sure you'll do this kind
of thing with your boyfriend some day. It's
better to learn how to do it now.

With Shido... I would like... to do it...
with Shido someday.

Right? If you spend time with him every day,
then it is bound to happen.

(What?! What's bound to happen...?
What did Origami... Wh-What the―?)
Step inside.
Keep listening.

(What did Origami do...? I need to go inside
and check at once.)
Origami!

(I don't know what's going on, but I need to
find out for myself.)

(But I'm curious about Origami. What should I
do?)

(Crap! Are they leaving the room? I don't
have anywhere to hide!)
Shido...?
Ah. Your boyfriend.

Hey, you're... Origami's... Kusakabe-san?
What are you doing here?

(Why on earth is Origami's boss at our
school?)

Oh, I held a disaster prevention seminar, and
I stopped to chat with Origami. We were just
reviewing the first aid items in the infirmary.
A-And... What were you guys doing?
Mm. You know...

We were swapping out the fluorescent lights.
I had to stand on top of the chair.
S-Swapping out the fluorescent lights?!

Yeah. They were dead, so I suggested that we
change them. Origami thought it was dangerous
to replace them while the switch was flipped.

Fluorescent lights heat up. However troubling
they may be, we must ensure they are off.

Yes. Origami admitted it was her first time
changing light bulbs, so I encouraged her to
try it out.
It was good experience.

Ah, I see. But I overheard you mention that
she might do it with me some day.

Yes, if you are still together. It's not crazy to
think you'll have to change light bulbs some
day, right Mr. Boyfriend?

Aah... Well, that's thinking far ahead. Who
knows what the future holds?

Oh, why are you blushing? Origami talks
about you often. Too late to be shy about
it now.
Gah... What have you told her, Origami?

I simply answered whatever questions she
asked me.
Have you been feeling tense lately?

No, no, no! You've only heard one side of
the story!
Well, I may have told her about my request.
You've done too much! Where is the nurse?!

Oh. A teacher got a sudden case of appendicitis
and was taken to the hospital. The nurse went
with her.

I see... Is it okay to change the light without
permission?

We didn't do it without permission. She gave
it to us before she left, right Origami?
That's right. She asked us.
See?
That's a relief.

If I'm not mistaken, your next class will be
a study block. I am heading home, so good
luck.

*sigh*... Okay. Thanks for stopping by,
Kusakabe-san.
Well, see you around, Mr. Boyfriend, Origami.
I didn't expect to run into her.
Why don't we head to class?
Okay, but... I have a suggestion before we do.
What is it?
We can head over, but it's only a study block.
Seems like it.
Then Shido, we should stay here in the infirmary.
You think we should ditch?

If it is just a study block, then we are not
ditching.

Hm. I mean, I'm not against it, but I'm shocked
that the valedictorian Origami would suggest
we ditch.
I want to talk with you... Please?

Sure. I guess we could ditch. It's not like
anyone actually studies in the study
block.

(And so, we spent the next hour inside of
the nurse's office.)

It is so nice and warm in here. So how are
we going to kill time?
How about we pour some coffee?
Is there any around?

There's instant coffee. We can boil hot water
with the kettle. All we need to do is add hot
water in the cup.

(Origami emptied a packet of coffee into a
beaker.)
You're going to put it in the beaker?

I do not think it will affect the flavor. Is this
not to your liking?

No, that's not it. Actually, it seems like a fun
idea. It's like we're in one of those dramas,
don't you think?

You may have a point. The only other thing
we can use would be the wash basin.
Yeah, I'll pass on that...
...It's done.

(I took the coffee she handed to me, and I
looked around.)

Hm. I've never had the chance to look at
the stuff inside of the nurse's office before.
It is certainly well-kept.

There are cotton swabs, alcohol, cold medicine,
anti-diarrheal... All the basics.
Shido, you can perform body measurements.

(Origami pointed at the device to measure
height.)
Oh, that could be interesting. Let's see...

(I got on the scale and slid the measurer
to gauge my height.)
What is it?

Hasn't changed since last time. I'll weigh
myself next.

(Then, I stepped on the scale adjacent to
the height measurer.)

What?! Hey, Origami! You stepped on the scale,
didn't you?
No, I did not.
Liar. Fine. You get on next, then.
...I cannot. Regulation forbids it.
Whose regulation?! Well, whatever...

What should we do next? Do you want to
measure your sitting height?

No, I'm fine now. What are other things we
can look at?

(I glanced at the objects around the room, and
saw a bed nearby wrapped in white sheets.)
Should we rest up a bit?
(I threw myself onto the white bed.)
Shido, you're bold.

Well, I've never visited the nurse's office.
It's something I always wanted to do...
HEY ORIGAMI?!
Why are you taking off your blazer?!
You said you wanted to get into the bed...
Hey, wait. I didn't mean anything by it.
Whoa. Hey, Origami...

(Origami started unbuttoning her blazer,
and mounted me lying on the bed.)

Origami, don't you think... this is kind of
inappropriate?

We're in an empty room. A bed. We are a man and
a woman. Given the circumstances, I think it
looks natural.

(Origami is sitting on top of me, pressing her
weight into the top of my pants.)
Whoa. Crap. Don't sit like that.

(I tried twisting myself, but she made it
difficult to squeeze out.)
Shido...

(Origami blushed, her breathing sped up.
It was like a switch was flipped.)

(She was starting to play with the buttons
on her blouse. I saw her pale white skin.)

(It was a seductive move, very enticing.
I gulped.)
Shido, can I sniff you like last time?

O-Okay, sure. But why don't we change
positions first...?
Today, I want to remain like this.
No, but...

(This was no good. Almost unbearable. I could
feel Origami tighten her legs around me.)

(I felt a rush of blood going to my head.
Come on, Shido. Keep it together!)
(I have no choice but to...)
Ask for forgiveness.
Scream for help.

Origami, at the very least, could you change how
you're sitting? I'm feeling... very uncomfortable.
...Like this?
(Origami slid her hips a bit.)
Agh... That's no good either.
...Then, this way?
(She slid herself again.)
N-No!
Then, like this?

NO! Stop moving up and down! You're
making it worse!
I cannot find the right position to sit in.

Th-Then, let's stop! Seriously. We can't do this
here...!

No, we cannot stop. My body is on fire.
Shido, be more dominant.

On fire...? Don't say it like that! Come on now,
woman!

(Origami sat on top of me, slowly inching her
face closer to mine.)
Origami...

(I can't escape anymore. We're crossing a line
here...)
(Just then―)
(I have no choice but to scream for help.)
S-Someoneeee! Help meeee!

We're in the middle of class right now.
This place is far from the classroom, so
no one will come. So give it up.
A-Ahhh...
Shido.
Wh-What is it?
Do like when people watch...?
N-No, of course not...

Then, what was your plan if someone really
had come?

I-If someone came in, then maybe you'd get
off of me?

To be honest, I would be paralyzed from
nervousness, and frozen in place.
What?! So, if someone came...

They most certainly would have seen us
like this.
That's dangerous!
Only kidding.

You were?! I guess if we're caught like this,
I'd have to do something.

(My body froze from nervousness, almost like
I was being bound.)

If you insist, I will have no choice but to get
up.

Don't make this into my fault! All right.
Let's get up.
(I tried getting up, but then―)
Excuse meeee.

(I heard someone stepping into the nurse's
office.)
Whoa! Someone's here. Crap. Hide, Origami!
(We hid in the bed.)

(If someone were to catch us here, it'd be
a mess. I hope we can get by.)
Hey, Origami...
Shido, it's tight in here.
Don't talk so loud. We'll get caught.
O-Origami, don't move.
But that's hard...
Ah, if you move there, I'll... *grunt*
Shido, be quiet or we'll get caught.
Hey, I said don't move... A-Ah. It tickles.

(Every time Origami moved, our bodies
rubbed together, sending a shiver down
my spine.)

(Luckily, the student who came in didn't
notice and left almost immediately after.)
(All that panicking tired me out.)
Man, that was close.
I found it quite thrilling.
It's because you couldn't sit still.
Shido, you were really hard!
Whoa! H-Hard...?
Your stomach.
A-Ah! My stomach! I see.
And it was big.
M-My chest, right?
No.
Then, was it...
Your arm.
Right! My arm!
And it was black.
Oh, you mean my hair?
No. Lower.
What?! L-Lower... What's down there...?
Your belt.
My belt?!
What a stimulating day. I'm quite satisfied.
(For some reason, my skin felt really glossy.)

Anyways, what do you want to do next? Should
we head to class?

We can do that. According to the clock, class is
almost over.
Then why don't we leave separately to class?
Got it. You can go first.
Okay.
(And so, we left the nurse's office.)

Itsuka, where were you during the study
block?
Out and about.

Come to think of it, Tobiichi wasn't there
either.
Er, well...

(Man, he's sharp. If we were both gone, I guess
it was obvious.)
We were in the infirmary togther.
What?!
You don't have to tell him!
Did you guys...?
It may be true.
We didn't do anything! Not a thing, okay?!

Whoa. You're such a pervert, Itsuka-kun.
You ditched class. Where do you think he
took Tobiichi-san?
Impure adultery. That's so gross.
So you've finally crossed the line.
N-No. Besides, Origami...
Shido, your behavior speaks for itself.
Th-That's not fair, Origami.
That's so lame.
Such a turn-off.
Super ★ turn-off.

Good-bye, Itsuka-kun. You and I belong to
different leagues now.
That's not true, you guys. Listen to me―

(Our secret got out to the whole school.
Soon everyone had heard about my
relationship with Origami.)

(Of course, with rumors came a flurry of
other things that weren't quite true.)

Itsuka-kun, I hear that you like to sniff
Tobiichi-san's underwear every day.

I heard he's extremely tough, hard, and
big-headed. A beast. A walking X-rating.

I heard Tobiichi-san is his 100th target. He
threw a party celebrating it the other day.
Poor Tobiichi-san. To be with a man like that...
(Things went from bad to worse...)
(Is there a light at the end of the tunnel?)
